1.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
1.str2: To lay off or aside, renounce, stow away, put. From apo and tithemi; to put away.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From kakos; badness, i.e. depravity, or malignity, or trouble.
Deceit, guile, treachery. From an obsolete primary verb, dello; a trick, i.e. wile.
From hupokrinomai; acting under a feigned part, i.e. deceit.
Envy, a grudge, spite. Probably akin to the base of phtheiro; ill-will, i.e. Jealousy.
Evil-speaking, backbiting, detraction, slander. From katalalos; defamation.

2.str2: Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Newly begotten, newly born. From arti and gennetos; just born, i.e. a young convert.
Infant, babe, child in arms. Of uncertain affinity; an infant literally or figuratively.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
2.str2: From epi and potheo; to dote upon, i.e. Intensely crave possession.
Unadulterated, pure, guileless. Undeceitful, i.e. unadulterated.
(a) reasonable, rational, (b) metaphorical, as contrasted with the literal. From logos; rational.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

2.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
2.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 2nd Person Plural
2.str2: (a) I cause to increase, become greater (b) I increase, grow. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to grow, i.e. Enlarge.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Feminine of a derivative of soter as noun; rescue or safety.

3.str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

3.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
3.str2: (a) I taste, (b) I experience. A primary verb; to taste; by implication, to eat; figuratively, to experience.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Useful, gentle, pleasant, kind. From chraomai; employed, i.e. useful.

4.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
4.str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

4.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
4.str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.

4.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
4.str2: To reject after testing (examination), disqualify. From apo and dokimazo; to disapprove, i.e. to repudiate.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
From eklegomai; select; by implication, favorite.
(held precious, hence) precious, honored, honorable in rank. From en and time; valued.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

5.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
5.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

5.str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.

5.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
5.str2: From the same as oikodome; to be a house-builder, i.e. Construct or confirm.
Spiritual. From pneuma; non-carnal, i.e. ethereal, or a spirit, or supernatural, regenerate, religious.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
The act or office of priesthood. From hierateuo; the priestly fraternity, i.e. Sacerdotal order.
From ana and phero; to take up.
Spiritual. From pneuma; non-carnal, i.e. ethereal, or a spirit, or supernatural, regenerate, religious.
Abstr. and concr: sacrifice; a sacrifice, offering. From thuo; sacrifice.
From eu and a derivative of prosdechomai; well-received, i.e. Approved, favorable.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

6.str2: On this account, because, for. From dia and hoti; on the very account that, or inasmuch as.

6.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
6.str2: From peri and echo; to hold all around, i.e. Include, clasp.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
(a) a writing, (b) a passage of scripture; plur: the scriptures. A document, i.e. Holy Writ.

6.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
6.str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!

6.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
6.str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Zion, the hill; used for Jerusalem or heaven. Of Hebrew origin; Sion, a hill of Jerusalem; figuratively, the Church.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.
From eklegomai; select; by implication, favorite.
(held precious, hence) precious, honored, honorable in rank. From en and time; valued.
In the corner (of a building); subst: corner-(stone). From akron and gonia; belonging to the extreme corner.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

6.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
6.str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

6.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
6.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

6.word: will never be put to shame.”
6.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
6.str2: From kata and aischunomai; to shame down, i.e. Disgrace or put to the blush.

7.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

7.str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A price, honor. From tino; a value, i.e. Money paid, or valuables; by analogy, esteem, or the dignity itself.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

7.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
7.str2: To be unfaithful, disbelieve, refuse belief, prove false. From apistos; to be unbelieving, i.e. disbelieve, or disobey.

7.str2: To reject after testing (examination), disqualify. From apo and dokimazo; to disapprove, i.e. to repudiate.

7.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
7.str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
A corner; met: a secret place. Probably akin to gonu; an angle.

8.str2: A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.
A stumbling-block, an occasion for falling, a moral embarrassment. From proskopto; a stub, i.e. occasion of apostasy.
A rock, ledge, cliff, cave, stony ground. Feminine of the same as Petros; a rock.
A snare, stumbling-block, cause for error. Scandal; probably from a derivative of kampto; a trap-stick, i.e. Snare.

8.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
8.str2: From pros and kopto; to strike at, i.e. Surge against; specially, to stub on, i.e. Trip up.

8.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
8.str2: To disobey, rebel, be disloyal, refuse conformity. From apeithes; to disbelieve.

From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.

Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.

Acquiring, obtaining, possessing, possession, ownership. From peripoieomai; acquisition; by extension, preservation.

Light, a source of light, radiance. From an obsolete phao; luminousness.

20.str2: Of what sort. From the base of pou and hoios; individualizing interrogative what sort of, or which one.
Glory, fame, praise; rumor, report, credit. From a shorter form of kaleo; renown.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

20.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
20.str2: To strike with the fist, buffet; hence: I mistreat violently. From a derivative of the base of kolazo; to rap with the fist.

20.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
20.str2: Perhaps from a and the base of meros; properly, to miss the mark, i.e. to err, especially to sin.

20.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
20.str2: From hupo and meno; to stay under, i.e. Remain; figuratively, to undergo, i.e. Bear, have fortitude, persevere.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

20.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
20.str2: I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.

20.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
20.str2: To do that which is good. From agathopoios; to be a well-doer.

20.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
20.str2: From hupo and meno; to stay under, i.e. Remain; figuratively, to undergo, i.e. Bear, have fortitude, persevere.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

21.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
21.str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
21.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

21.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
21.str2: To leave behind. A prolonged form for hupoleipo; to leave behind, i.e. Bequeath.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
21.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A writing-copy, an example, pattern. From a compound of hupo and grapho; an underwriting, i.e. Copy for imitation.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
21.str2: To follow close after, accompany, dog; I imitate, pursue, be studious of. From epi and akoloutheo; to accompany.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A track, footstep. From ikneomai; a track.

22.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
22.str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.
Deceit, guile, treachery. From an obsolete primary verb, dello; a trick, i.e. wile.

22.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
22.str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

22.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
22.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The mouth, speech, eloquence in speech, the point of a sword.

23.word: When they heaped abuse on Him,
23.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
23.str2: To revile a person to his face, abuse insultingly. From loidoros; to reproach, i.e. Vilify.

23.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
23.str2: To abuse in return, give abuse for abuse. From anti and loidoreo; to rail in reply.

23.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
23.str2: I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.

23.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
23.str2: To threaten, forbid by threatening. Of uncertain derivation; to menace; by implication, to forbid.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

23.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
23.str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

23.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
23.str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
Justly, righteously. Adverb from dikaios; equitably.

24.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
24.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

24.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
24.str2: From ana and phero; to take up.

24.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
24.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

24.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
24.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From another form of the base of xestes; timber; by implication, a stick, club or tree or other wooden article or substance.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

24.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
24.str2: To be away, be removed from, depart life, die. Past participle of a compound of apo and ginomai; absent, i.e. Deceased.

24.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
24.str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.

24.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular

24.str2: A bruise, stripe, left on the body by scourging. From molos and probably ops; a mole or blow-mark.

24.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
24.str2: To heal, generally of the physical, sometimes of spiritual, disease. Middle voice of apparently a primary verb; to cure.

25.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

25.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
25.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A sheep. Probably neuter of a presumed derivative of probaino; something that walks forward, i.e., a sheep.

25.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
25.str2: To lead astray, deceive, cause to wander. From plane; to roam.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.

25.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
25.str2: From epi and strepho; to revert.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A shepherd; hence met: of the feeder, protector, and ruler of a flock of men. Of uncertain affinity; a shepherd.
From epi and skopos; a superintendent, i.e. Christian officer in genitive case charge of a church.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

25.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
25.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.
